title: Channel Islands National Park: 2013 Archived Lecture Videos
body: 2013 "From Shore to Sea" Archived Lecture Videos       Please note that there are only six lectures in the 2013 series: March, April, May, September, October, and November.             Marine Protected Areas: Ten Years of Protection and its Effect on Fisheries within Channel Islands National Park   Loading the player...       Visit JWPlayer docs for keyboard shortcuts  Duration:1 hour, 10 minutes, 33 seconds  In March, to commemorate the ten year anniversary of Marine Protected Areas at the Channel Islands, Marine Ecologist Carol Blanchette discussed their effectiveness for both conservation and fisheries management.                    The Recovery of Anacapa Island   Loading the player...       Visit JWPlayer docs for keyboard shortcuts  Duration:48 minutes, 47 seconds  The May From Shore to Sea lecture featured two biologists, Kate Faulkner and Jennifer Boyce, discussing the recovery of Anacapa Island a decade after the removal of nonnative rats.               Harnessing Fog Drip for Island Recovery: A Test Case on Santa Rosa Island   Loading the player...       Visit JWPlayer docs for keyboard shortcuts  Duration:54 minutes, 3 seconds  The September From Shore to Sea lecture featured Dr. Kathyrn McEachern’s research on how environmental changes have affected the way coastal fog sustains vegetation on the Channel Islands.         Due to the government shutdown, there was no lecture in October.            Life in a Chumash Village   Loading the player...       Visit JWPlayer docs for keyboard shortcuts  Duration:1 hour, 9 minutes, 37 seconds  The November From Shore to Sea lecture featured Dr. Todd Braje who discussed what life was like in the Chumash village of Qshiwqshiw on Santa Rosa Island at the dawn of European contact.
